message: What we do need is a list of features that makes sense given the language, else we won't be able to use the list to guide us very well.
We love user requests. If the 'vote for your favorite feature' sites didn't cost so much, we'd be using one. :)
There are also stars on messages in the same topic, though I'm not sure how we tell who's on top.
We could start a discussion here, and see which bubbles to the top.
I understand. I really want to know more about the constraints of the platform, where can I get more info about it?
So we start a thread where stars are the votes, then display that info with the API.

I know democracy is not always the most efficient or reasonable thing but would some kind of "feature list" ( for developers or users ) in which we could vote be something useful? At least it would be a good indicator. I was thinking of putting such a list on stackoverflow...
My thoughts exactly!
I guess one topic = one feature would be the clearest way to do that.
I think an app that let you easily post links to convore from any site would be awesome
Maybe I'll mockup what a Convore app could look like and through it out there to see if anyone would be interested in building it :)
Ah, the API will show the star count on messages in a topic. Actually, it will show who starred it as well.
time for a kynetx app to augment convore then !
So convore already shows the names of Star-ers.
but not the count.
yes do that!
ouch... we got starred, this feature will make it into KRL now... congratulations Randall.
Feature request: Date conversions to Mayan. Today is Haab: 19 Pop and Tzolkin: 6 Chuen (long count 12.19.18.5.11)
lol !! so actually you want to introduce a millennium bug inside KRL that will raise once their calendar ends?
Now we can celebrate 6 Chuen (happens every 260 days)!
Yeah, let's celebrate now that the end of the world is close thanks to your feature. :)
You guys kill me.
Not the end of the world, just the start of a new b'ak'tun.
I feel better. I can keep on coding.
Behold: Today on the Mayan Calendar http://ktest.heroku.com/a421x56

your url makes me think that it would be cool if an url coud reference a website and launch an app automatically. In some utopic world websites would allow to pass javascript apps to enhance their functionnalities. Have you ever tried to inject a kynetx app in an iframe? There are security restrictions but sometimes  new tricks appear that make things possible.
